intro: Cakile lanceolata var. apetala, commonly known as the leafy cress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as disturbed soils and rocky areas. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a slightly hairy texture. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and are pollinated by insects.
